title: Sri Lanka stocks trade 0.6-pct stronger in mid-day trade
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka stocks gained over 0.6 percent within the first hour of trade on Friday (10), Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
The main All Share Price Index moved up 0.6 percent or 50.69 points to 7,931.82 at 11.35 hrs.
The most liquid index S&P SL20 up 0.5 percent or 13.13 points to 2,580.87.
Market generated a turnover of 761 million rupees, less than a quarter of this year’s average 3.8 billion rupees.
